{"step_by_step_thinking": "Boiled lobster syndrome is a term used to describe the appearance of the skin after phenol burns. Phenol is a corrosive substance that can cause severe skin burns, leading to a reddened, blistered appearance that resembles a boiled lobster. Boric acid, HNO, and H2SO4 do not cause this specific syndrome.", "answer_choice": "D. Phenol"}
